results.title: Tobacco growing
results.brief_description:
Cultivation of tobacco, season by season on a Southern Rhodesian estate, from the preparation of the ground to the curing and grading of the leaves.
This is a silent film.

results.title: Toast
results.brief_description: “Humour is a universal language,” says Edie Kurzer, and it’s an element she weaves into much of her artistic output. It’s also something that attracted her to the unique portraiture work of Sydney artist Heather Mitchell. Better known for her stage and screen presence, Mitchell has found a growing audience for her toast portraits of Australian celebrities in her medium of choice: Vegemite. Creating these slices especially for our display, she has shone a tasty spotlight on some of our most singular screen faces such as Josh Thomas, Lee Lin Chin, Deborah Mailman and others.

constellations_other.name: Ladies who own the narrative
constellations_other.description: Despite the lag in making it in mainstream cinema, female action heroes can actually be traced back to the late 19th century in early magic lantern performances of Jane Conquest, who saved both her child and a ship full of men.

results.title: Toast
results.brief_description: Focuses on the excessive use of fossil fuels in the preparation and marketing of food by tracing the production and distribution of a loaf of bread. Also illustrates the concept of net energy profit.

results.title: Toads: some are, some aren't
results.brief_description: Two “talking” animals - Warty Bliggens, a true toad and Cactus Clyden, a horned toad - describes the characteristics of their bodies, their behaviour and there natural habitats. Close up photography reveals the differences between the two animals, and the viewer soon learns that the horned toad is not a toad at all, but a horned lizard with entirely different characteristics from those of the true toad

results.title: Toads
results.brief_description: The toad is seen as one of the few remaining descendants of the prehistoric amphibians. Shows the life cycle from a water-born to a land-dwelling animal, and how the toad procures food, protects itself and can live even in desert areas.

results.title: To your health
results.brief_description: Referring to the many varied opinions about alcohol, the film sets out to deal only with facts. The distribution and fate of the drug in the body is shown, and its anaesthetic properties affecting reasoning, inhibitions, memory, the special senses and muscular co-ordination described.

results.title: To Win at All Costs
results.brief_description: This is an absorbing account of the men, money and boats involved in the glittering social and sporting event that is America’s Cup yacht racing. It tells the fascinating story of the longest winning streak in sport’s history from the first race in 1851 to the highly dramatic and much publicised series of 1983 races held off Newport, Rhode Island. America, defending the coveted trophy for the 25th time, was finally beaten, giving an historic victory to the challenging “Australia II”.

results.title: To warm the world
results.brief_description: Describes the manufacture of Laconia woollen blankets as seen through the eyes of a little girl who cares for her own flock of sheep and wonders what happens to the wool after her sheep are shorn. Shows the fleece being scoured, dyed, carded and spun into yarn; weaving, milling, piece dyeing and mothproofing processes; and the drying, cutting and finishing of each blanket.

results.title: To track a shadow
results.creator_credit: George Kaczender, William Canning and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: There is sometimes danger and excitement, but always a patient follow-up of clues when the R.C.M.P. hunt a killer. This film re-enacts a case from the files of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police to show what is involved in modern crime detection. Some clues turn up in the laboratory; the trail of evidence leads from a lonely Alberta road to a British Columbia lumber camp and a final shootout with the murderer.

results.title: To touch a child
results.brief_description: Shows an example of an American school which opened its doors as a community centre for sport, entertainment, and educational activities. Explains how the community responded to the successful project and how it has extended to further schools in the city.
